scl10.uk.ac.aber.users.manipulators

Class PatchedImageTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • scl10.uk.ac.aber.users.manipulators.PatchedImageTest

  • public class PatchedImageTest
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for testing the functionality of the PatchedImage class
    Author:
    Scott Lockett

      • patch

        The patch size the the patched imaged will be.

      • patchedGroundTruthPatterns

        private static final org.sikuli.script.Pattern[] patchedGroundTruthPatterns
        An array of the ground truth images for each patch we're going to be testing against. Its not feasible to test every single pixel to we're going to set the top left, top right, bottom left, bottom right and central pixel locations.

      • patchedImage

        private static final PatchedImage patchedImage
        Create a patched image based on the original test image. This is the object that will be test.

      • pointsOffImage

        private static final java.awt.Point[] pointsOffImage
        A series of points that go outside of the images range. They're the three points surrounding each corner

      • testFile

        private static final java.io.File testFile
        The test file of the image that will be used for the tests. The reason this specific image chosen was due to the fact that every patch from this image will always be different. In many images, there is a large amount of black or white around the sides (such was the case for the artificial neural network training data) and so if something goes wrong in the test it might not be detected if it's already been compared with a large black area. Using an image like this allows for every patch to be unique across all corners annd allows for a reliable test. Image was taken from this source. This image is licensed under the Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 2.0 Generic (CC BY-NC-SA 2.0) license. And is attributed to Tolka Rover

      • testImage

        private static final java.awt.image.BufferedImage testImage
        Read the image file as a buffered image into the program.

    • Method Detail

      • imagePatchsFromInvalidCentralPixelsTest

        public void imagePatchsFromInvalidCentralPixelsTest()
        Tests that a series of positions outside of the images range and ensures that ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException are thrown

      • imagePatchsFromValidCentralPixelsTest

        public void imagePatchsFromValidCentralPixelsTest()
        Tests the creation of a series of patches derived from the patched image at certain positions. These positions are the top left, top right, bottom left, bottom right and central. The position used within this test are also a method of stress testing by choosing patches from the very edges of the image. This could probably be broken down into much smaller tests for each position.

      • testPatchIsTooSmall

        public void testPatchIsTooSmall()
